page.title: 12Halesworth Supernatural
page.content: Visitors to this part of East Anglia say it has a supernatural"feel".The most famous supernatural manifestation in Halesworth Middle Section is the devin the form of a black dog,known as Black Shuck.Seeing Black Shuck foretells disaster.Ella Lambert saw Black Shuck on Fenn Farm the night before Fenn Farm cottages burnt down in 1926.A more recent ghost sighting was by Mr.Davey,formerly of the Mace Shop, Quay ST.,who saw a"spiv"character in his shop in 1983.Doris Lambert,who lived in Chediston ST.,claimed to have second sight because she was born at"Chime hours"i.e. when the clock struck twelve.At 80 Chediston ST.,where the History teacher lives,is a ghost called Squire Baker and the gost of a girl who sits in a window,the owner hasn't.Four people where hanged for practising witchcraft,in 1645.
